column4: hello guys ! does anyone know how is determined the default graphic mode (i mean the one seted up uner X after boot) ?
nano /etc/X11/xorg.conf
I've looked in it and search around the web: if the xorg defines different modes which one is "chosen" on startup ?
ah I see what your saying, let me look into it - Default Resolution
in your xorg.conf file do you have a line which look like:
got this one: Option         "metamodes" "DFP: 1680x1050 +0+0, TV: 1024x768 +0+0;DFP: 1024x768 +0+0, TV: 1024x768 +0+0"
ooo, tricky, i would make a backup copy and remove the modes you don't want as default, or try to rearrange them
nvidia-settings wrote those lines ...
yes, thats fine, i just don't want you to mess things up
how experienced are you in linux?
by default my screen is at 1024x768. I can make a "xrandr" to switch upper without problem
I'm not a newbie
have you tried: sudo dpkg-reconfigure -phigh xserver-xorg
no
write that line down, and do alt+ctrl+F1 and try that line
sudo dpkg-reconfigure -phigh xserver-xorg
when you do ctrl+alt+f1 to come back to GUI do ctrl+alt+f7
I try this, thanks
good luck, when it asks you possible resolutions, just chose the one you want only
done it, I restart
same problem, X starts in 1024 ... here is the xorg.conf "modes" line: Modes  "1680x1050" "1024x768" "800x600"
